page.title: 17"Bowcombe"-Recreation.
page.content: Not surprisingly, field sports figure largely in the leisure activities of most of those in the area involved in farming, though it became clear that most of the farmers worked long hours, which left little time for hobbies or pastimes. Indeed, as one pointed out; shooting vermin such as pigeons and rabbits is really one of the less arduous aspects of the job. The demands upon a busy farmer's wife too are perhaps greater than those upon a normal housewife. To others in the area, and to other Islanders and tourists, Bowcombe is a picturesque area for walking with many well sign-posted paths crossing it. One in particular; the Tennyson Trail, so called after the famous poet who lived at nearbye Mottistone, forms a part of one of the most attractive and scenic walks on the Island.
